Detailed Description

Class Timed Schedule

The Schedule class provides the methods required to generate a valid schedule for Lekin
A schedule is a multi-demensional array which contains in its i,j position the job processed j-th on the i-th machine

Member Function Documentation

void afsjava.TimedSchedule.addToTimedSchedule ( int  jobNumber,
int  wksNumber,
int  mchNumber,
Tjob[]  jobArray,
Workcenter[]  wkcArray 
)

Adds a job operation to a TimedSchedule object. This method adds the operation of the jobNumber-th job to the machNumber-th machine of the wksNumber-th workstation.
Only works if all job precedences have been scheduled; otherwise throws an exception.
This methods also calculates the earliest setup start time, the setup end time, the start and the end of the scheduled operation

Parameters:
jobNumber 
wksNumber 
mchNumber 
Exceptions:
Exception 
void afsjava.TimedSchedule.getPerformance ( Tjob[]  jobArray,
int  jobNumber 
)

Calculates the performance indicators of a schedule when a new job is scheduled. Makespan, max Tardiness, number of Tardy jobs, Total and Total Weighted Flow Time and Total and Total Weighted Tardiness.

void afsjava.TimedSchedule.printToLekin (  ) 

The current timed scheduled is written to the _user.seq file in Lekin.
